meanings.definition: To calculate the total of a subset of numbers.
meanings.sent1: I will subtotally add the scores of the first three rounds.
meanings.sent2: She subtotally summed up the expenses for the week.
meanings.sent3: The math wizard subtotally worked his magic on the tricky equation.
meanings.sent4: The accountant subtotally pieced together the financial report.
meanings.sent5: Subtotally breaking down the data made the analysis easier.

meanings.definition: In a partial or incomplete manner.
meanings.sent1: He subtotally completed the puzzle, leaving a few pieces out.
meanings.sent2: The artist subtotally painted the background of the portrait.
meanings.sent3: The chef subtotally mixed the ingredients, forgetting the main one.
meanings.sent4: The detective subtotally solved the case, missing a crucial clue.
meanings.sent5: Subtotally finishing the project, she skipped the final step.
